valañjeti：[ava-lañj] たどる，跡づける，行く，行う； 用いる，費やす．pp．valañjita たどれる．
Valañjeti，（valaj + e），追蹤，沿路走，使用，花費，求助。 【過】 ~esi。 【過分】 ~jita。 【現分】 ~jenta。 【獨】 ~jetvā。 【潛】 ~jetabba。（p279）
Valañjeti，（valaj +e），追蹤，沿路走，使用，花費，求助。【過】valañjesi。【過分】valañjjita。【現分】valañjenta。【獨】valañjetvā。【義】valañjetabba。

valañjeti： valañjeti（kri）
ဝလဉ္ဇေတိ（ကြိ）
«vaḷaji（valaji）+ṇa+ti．ka．446．rū．5va9．»
[ဝဠဇိ（ဝလဇိ）+ဏ+တိ။ ကစ္စည်း။၄၄၆။ရူ။၅ဝ၉။]
valañjeti：[valaj + e] tracks； traces； uses； spends； resorts to．

Valañjeti，[customarily expld as ava+lañj （cp．Geiger P．Gr．§ 661），the root lañj being given as a Sk．root in meaning “to fry，” “to be strong，” and a variety of others （see Mon．Williams s．v．lañj）．But the root & its derivations are only found in lexicographical and grammatical works，therefore it is doubtful whether it is genuine．lañja is given as “pada，” i．e．track，place，foot，and also “tail．” We are inclined to see in lañj a by-form of lañch，which is a variant of lakṣ “to mark” etc．（cp．lañcha，lañchaka，°ana，°ita）．Thus the meaning would range from originally “trace，” mark off，enclose，to：“being enclosed，” assigned or belonging to，i．e．moving （in），frequenting etc．as given in C．explns．There seems to be a Singhalese word at the root of it，as it is certainly dialectical．-- The Dhtm （522） laconically defines valañj as “valañjane”] 1．to trace，track，travel （a road）； practise，achieve，resort to Miln．359； VvA．58．-- 2．to use，use up，spend J．I，102； III，342； VI，369，382，521．-- ppr．Pass．（a-）valañjiyamāna （not any longer） in use J．I，111．-- pp．valañjita．（Page 602）
VALAÑJETI：（valaj+e） vạch ra，cần dùng，bồi bổ lại，xài phí，đi theo con đường đã vạch [aor] --esi [pp] jita [prp] jenta [abs] jetvā [ptp] jetabba

valañjeti：ဝလဉ္ဇေတိ（ကြိ）
[ဝဠဇိ（ဝလဇိ）+ဏ+တိ။ ကစ္စည်း။၄၄၆။ရူ။၅ဝ၉။]
သုံးဆောင်-သုံးစွဲ-မှီဝဲ-၏။

valañjeti：ဝလဉ္ဇေတိ （အဝ√လဉ္ဇ်）
သုံးဆောင်၏။
